sen.e: However, in reality, Tadazane was 22 in 1099 when his father Moromichi died suddenly and he became Sessho (Regent) at a tender age (younger than his great grandfather who took on the role at 26 years) and as he had not even served as a Minister, he did not become Kampaku (Chancellor) and was confined to private audiences and, as for his grandfather FUJIWARA no Morozane who was already retired, he had no remaining influence to support Tadazane leading to a decline in the power of the Sekkan-ke (family eligible to be Regents).
